page.title: 07VILLAGES
page.content: Startforth We have part of Startforth in our area.There is a{school}there which was built in 1877.Startforth Hall was built in 1590.It was just a little farm house until 1747 when it was enlarged into the Hall.The records were thought to be destroyed in the Great Fire of London.It has 16 rooms and 2 acres of garden.There is an old pump near the bottom of the drive, the date of which is not known.The hall is owned by Mr.John Cooke_Hurle.There is Church which was built before the Norman Conquest.There are no shops in Startforth.There are a few residences in the part of Startforth.The school in Startforth has a hall which is also the village hall.It is used as a gymn, for keep fit classes ,youth club, indoor bowls and various meetings.It has 4 classes containing 114 pupils.
